item.dc:creator: @Bebemycat2 Bebe
item.description:
@Bebemycat2 wrote:

I didn’t say the next version of SCAR will have it, cause I think kait didn’t like the idea. But he might offer it anyway. Maybe in SCAR or maybe as a package with SCAR.

No clue…

Just wait and see…

Read full topic

item.title: Scar Auto Formatter?
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

[quote=“Aftermath_96, post:26, topic:2693”]Doesn’t SCAR auto-format it already?

Just use TAB and BACKSPACE.[/quote]
We’re talking about a 1 button click like in real compilers. All compilers except for scar have auto formatters. At least, according to bebemycat2, we’ll have it in the next version of scar in 2007 lol since Kaitnieks has the code.

Read full topic

item.title: Scar Auto Formatter?
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

[quote=“Bebemycat2, post:25, topic:2693”]There is no need for one, but if I remember, kait has the code (was posted by pups, regeX or asdf, I can’t remember which one :P) for it.

I think that people should just not be lazy, but then agian we do have crazy scripting standards like Fakawi’s or Wizzup?'s which is extremly “dirty” in my opinion.
Maybe it’s not such a bad idea afterall…

Naw, in some cases standards individualize some peoples scripting style. :D[/quote]
I have been told my standards are messy, and like Fakawi’s, and Dankness’s.

I think people should do they’re own standards. Infact, if there was an Auto Formatter I probably wouldn’t use it. I like to standardize my scripts by myself.

Also, aftermath, thats not auto-formatting, thats manual formatting. :rolleyes:

Read full topic

item.title: Scar Auto Formatter?
item.dc:creator: @Bebemycat2 Bebe
item.description:
@Bebemycat2 wrote:

[code]program Blue;

var
a: integer;

procedure blue;
begin
if (a = 0)then
begin
writeLn(‘Variable a is 0 so blue is awesome!’);
end;
end;

begin
a:= 0;
blue;
end.[/code]

Pups, Kait is still working on SCAR, but is not working on it at the steedy pace he was before.

Read full topic
